Miscellaneous Highlights: LeBron James has officially tied Vince Carter's record for the most seasons played in the NBA at 22.
LeBron James and his son Bronny James checked in the game with four minutes left in the second quarter to make history.
Others: The Lakers bowed out in the first round to the Denver Nuggets, while the Timberwolves eliminated the Nuggets and advanced to the Western Conference Finals, where they fell to the Dallas Mavericks.
LeBron James posted averages of 25.7 ppg, 8.3 apg and 7.3 rpg, shooting 54.0% from the field, 41.0% from 3-point range and 75.0% from the free throw line last season.
As of opening night, only five players were aged 39 or older: James, P.J. Tucker, Chris Paul and Taj Gibson.
